Judul: Adjusting Porosity And Permeability Estimation By Nuclear Magnetic Resonance: a Case Study From a Carbonate Reservoir Of South of Iran
Abstrak:
The aim of this study is to assess the accuracy of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) method in estimating the porosity
and permeability in a carbonate reservoir located in south of Iran. In this study, 26 carbonate samples were selected and
common core and NMR experiments were performed. Comparison of core and NMR porosity showed that NMR method is
very accurate for estimation of porosity. However, after comparison of core and NMR permeability, it was found that NMR
permeability estimation cannot be used with the common coefficients since they are calibrated in the clastic reservoirs.
Therefore, it is necessary to modify coefficients in the permeability models of the considered reservoirs. For this purpose,
16 samples were selected to develop the model, and 10 samples for evaluating the accuracy of the model. In this study, freefluid and mean T2 models were two main models for permeability estimation using NMR method. Coefficients of the two
above-mentioned models were modified in terms of maximizing the coefficient of determination of core permeability and
calculated permeability using NMR permeability models. The proposed models were used to estimate permeability in 10
other samples for verifying the reliability of models
Kata Kunci: Nuclear magnetic resonance, Permeability model, Porosity, Timur-Coates model Schlumberger Doll Research model
Sumber: Journal of Petroleum Exploration and Production Technology, Volume 8, Issue 4, 1113-1127 (December 2018), https://doi.org/10.1007/s13202-018-0474-z
